Misnomer.definition: the misnaming of a person in a legal document or proceeding
Misnomer.origin: [Anglo-French mesnomer , from mesnomer to misname, from Middle French mes- wrongly + nommer to name, from Latin nominare , from nomin- nomen name]

1.1: the misnaming of a person in a legal document or proceeding (as in a complaint or indictment)

2.1: the institution of proceedings against and service of process on the correct party using the incorrect name compare
2.note: Amendment of the pleadings is generally allowed in cases of misnomer.
